ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If We had sent it down to a non-Arab
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Had We revealed it to a man of obscure tongue
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (But such is their adamance) that had We revealed it to one of the non-Arabs and even if he had recited (this clear Arabic discourse) to them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Had We revealed it to a non-Arab
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And had We sent it down upon a person other than an Arab,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if We had revealed it unto any of the non-Arabs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if we had revealed it to any of the foreigners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: If We had sent it down on a barbarian
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if We had revealed it unto one of any other nation than the Arabs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Had We revealed it to any one of the non-Arabs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And had We revealed it unto any of the ncn-Arabs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Had We sent it down upon some non-Arab
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if We had revealed it (this Quran) unto any of the non-Arabs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: If We had revealed it to a nonArab,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Had We revealed it to one of the foreigners.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:198] For had We revealed it to some non-Arabs (a‘jamūn is the plural of a‘jam),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if We had revealed it) and if We sent Gabriel with the Qur'an (unto one of any other nation than the Arabs) to a person who spoke no Arabic,
